text: Moldova competed in the Winter Olympic Games as an independent nation for the first time at the 1994 Winter Olympics in Lillehammer, Norway. == Biathlon == ;Men {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="3"|Final |- !Time !Pen. !Rank |- |rowspan=2|Vasily Gherghy |10 km sprint |align="center"|34:48.0 |align="center"|3 !align="center"|68 |- |20 km individual |align="center"|1:16:30.4 |align="center"|9 !align="center"|70 |} ;Women {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="3"|Final |- !Time !Pen. !Rank |- |rowspan=2|Elena Gorohova |7.5 km sprint |align="center"|35:04.1 |align="center"|7 !align="center"|69 |- |15 km individual |align="center"|1:13:33.1 |align="center"|14 !align="center"|68 |} ==References== *Official Olympic Reports * Olympic Winter Games 1994, full results by sports-reference.com Category:Nations at the 1994 Winter Olympics 1994 Winter
title: Moldova at the 1994 Winter Olympics
